lexUnit.name: horror.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an intense feeling of fear, shock, or disgust or intense dismay.

sentence.text: The Repton boy 's horror at Churchill 's anti-Bolshevist campaign had turned into a more adult and less ferocious criticism .
As the war dragged on Modigliani 's horror at the waste of life increased .
To me that puts us in a difficult position when trying Germans , whose crime was obeying their superiors " orders , whatever our horror at what those orders led to . "

The horror in her voice was almost ludicrous , and Briant raised his eyebrows slightly .

Even as he spoke , she saw the dawning horror in his eyes .

Nothing could wash away the beastliness of that house or the horror of the sight of Phyllis Henley 's body , but he felt the need to try .
Imagine the horror on my beloved 's face when he discovered I had in fact flung in the rubbish his much prized and read collection of Guitarist magazines !
Melanie was shocked to see the horror on her aunt 's face .
Charlotte looked at Ursula and saw a frozen expression of horror on her face .

Rather than match China 's firmness , it can be confidently predicted , the Hong Kong authorities will follow past form , cease muttering about their shock and horror over Tiananmen , and return to bland assurances that the negotiations with Peking about a post-1997 ` Basic Law " for Hong Kong are going well .

But the blank horror over Khmer Rouge atrocities between 1975 and 1978 has created a blind spot about its strength in Cambodia , and the growing likelihood that it will return to power , either on its own or with the other Cambodian opposition factions .
I am interested in hearing from women about their fascination and horror with cars , especially women in the Yorkshire region .

You can imagine my horror !

Ray Shepherd 's voice was quiet and he ignored his son 's mounting horror .
Meanwhile Crowe , who had been watching the carnage unfold from the other end with increasing horror , unfurled some strokes of class in an attempt to ease the situation .
Some of us contemplate this prospect with horror .
She gazed at Ruth , and her face seemed to fill up with horror .
` Did you have a good day at the office ? " she asked , hearing herself with horror .
Horror by gunfire differs little from horror inflicted by the guillotine , sword or wheel , it seems , and sheer bestiality lurks only fractionally below the veneer of so-called civilized societies .

Aston Villa are having a great run , but they hold no particular horrors for the Norwich players .

It was as if Gillray 's avaricious monarch was more of an affront than the voluptuary suffering from the horrors of dissipation .
Alison had shown enough respectable horror on discovering that he was married to prove she was a nice girl .
Imagine my horror at seeing her step out followed by a man !
` You can imagine our horror at finding a false ceiling in a secure establishment and ducts like this .
This ` return to the sources " discovers either that such primitive celebrations are entirely divorced from modern sexuality , or that they always concealed a deathly horror .
For Swift , there is a connection between cosmetics and prostitution ; the carefully assembled exterior often conceals both physical horror and moral contamination .
To see him fumbling with our rich and delicate language is to experience all the horror of seeing a Svres vase in the hands of a chimpanzee .

I wanted to express my fear and my horror .
The Government have expressed their horror at such attacks on the police , but they also need to act .

Under danger , in the dark , one feels a kind of particular horror at finding oneself alone .
He paused before stepping out onto the roof , a look of horror on his face .
He saw the look of horror on my face .
The idea of their having a say in the running of a club appears to make officials recoil with horror .
I have climbed it from all sides , every time making new discoveries , finding new surprises and delights and , let me confess , secret places from which I have recoiled in horror .
Ashley recoiled in horror .

Yanto realised to his horror he was now the nearest man to the exit bar .
To Shiona 's absolute horror , Jake had blamed her .
People waiting for trains watched in horror as the violence spread towards the Festi Hall .
Rex watched in horror as the black claw tore Bill 's left arm from its socket and flung it far up the street .
